text: decided using R Markdown format powerful tool allows write code text without copy paste output/images/tables. support several languages including python, BASH, SQL. importantly: code rendering features purely optional; can strip away R-associated content left markdown document. system already used R lessons several years works fairly well.

title: Building and Deployment of a {sandpaper} lesson
text: preview lessons, build static files locally, without servers. possible go directly R Markdown HTML, use two-step process: Generate static markdown source files hash original file YAML header Using external style template, generate website HTML built markdown files NOTE: need make sure renv environment defined lessons, think need happen things released CRAN avoid maxing github api requests. title: Set individual keys in a configuration file — set_config
text: following keypairs known sandpaper, optional: lang [character] language code matches language lesson content. defaults "en", can language code (e.g. "ja" specifying Japanese) combination language code country code (e.g. "pt_BR" specifies Pourtugese used Brazil). information used, see Locale Names section gettext manual url [character] custom URL deploying URL default github pages io domain. fail_on_error [boolean] R Markdown lessons; fail build chunks produce error. Use #| error: true chunk options allow error displayed workbench-beta [boolean] truthy, displays banner site indicates site workbench beta phase. overview [boolean] lessons must episodes exception overview lessons. indicate lesson serves overview lessons, use overview: true handout [boolean] [character] option instructs {sandpaper} create handout RMarkdown files via {pegboard}, uses knitr::purl() background removing everything challenges (without solutions) code blocks purl = TRUE. default path handout files/code-handout.R workbench becomes developed, optional keys may disappear.
